title: Why does BTS use a lot of auto-tune in their latest albums? In my opinion, it only ruins their songs and beautiful voices. What do you think? - Quora

response.answer_text: I don't share this opinion. You are entitled to your opinion, as always for any opinion. I haven't heard a lot of autoned BTS (even lately). And when it's autotuned, it's slight (at least to me). Fake Love, Black Swan and Ego are the three I can think of. With Fake Love and Black Swan, it was slight (imo) and artistic. Like it fit the song and wasn't jarring and I didn't really notice at first. For me, autotune is fine in those cases. A non-kpop example is “Heartless” by Kanye West (not a huge fan of his but I love that song). With Ego, it's only a few lines and again it just fits with the tempo and all before switching to J-Hope's natural vocals. I only have an issue with autotune when it reaches Rebecca Black's “Friday” levels. If I'm honest here, the autotune in Cat & Dog by TXT bothers me more than anything of BTS's.

Oooh, interesting! I’ve always thought of autotune as the seasoning of a meal! If you overdo it, the meal is awful, but not enough and it’s plain and boring! I’ve also noticed BTS has quite the variety of vocal range, sometimes the autotune helps blend their voices and help them not to sound like they’re straining. For example, I’ve picked up in the live performances that Dynamite is a little high for Taehyung, but on the track he sounds fine. Now I understand the point of their beautiful voices, I love JK’s twitter songs and other moments where they sing live, so there’s nothing wrong with that! I haven’t noticed it being too much in my opinion, but then again you’re talking to someone who loves Anpanman so🤷‍♀️😂💜
